intro: Lepigonum longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed lepigonum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, delicate blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Lepigonum longipes is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained, sunny conditions.
